comments:
with hyades 3.0.1.1, it was the other way round: the package-name doesn't ever  
get exported, when it is displayed

Hi Michael,

Can you explain how to reproduce the problem? It's unclear to me what is missing
in the export html file. Moreover, TPTP 3.0.2 is closed. The current development
release is TPTP 4.0, would you please verify if problem still exist in the
latest driver? Thanks.

Hi Eugene,

> Can you explain how to reproduce the problem?
I get the following column-headers in my HTML-export-file with TPTP 3.0.2:
Method Names, Package, Base Time, Average Base Time, Cumulative Time, Calls
inside eclipse (when viewing the "Execution Time Analysis"), 
the "Class Names"-column is displayed, too. And that's the one missing
in the HTML-output...

> would you please verify if problem still exist in the latest driver?
sorry, I could not get TPTP 4.0 to work in my environment
(client: Windows 2000, Eclipse 3.0.2, Server: Suse Linux 9.2
with Kernel Version 2.6.4-52): Eclipse TPTP gets the connection
to the RAServer, but then the data-collecting fails.

Here the stack-trace from the .log-file:

!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Launching".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
	at org.eclipse.hyades.loaders.util.LoadersUtils.setSessionStartTime
(LoadersUtils.java:846)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.util.PDCoreUtil.createUniqueAgent
(PDCoreUtil.java:965)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.util.PDCoreUtil.attach
(PDCoreUtil.java:174)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfileAttachDelegate.launch
(ProfileAttachDelegate.java:106)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:569)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUIPlugin.java:788)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run
(DebugUIPlugin.java:955)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Hi Michael.

Regarding the first part, The problem does not exist in TPTP 4.0 anymore.
Columns show in view are also created in html file exported.

For the second part, TPTP 4.0 built on top of Eclipse 3.1 rc1. (you were using
Eclipse 3.0.2). From the .log file entries, it seems like it's something with
the binaries. Please make sure you also update your Data Collection Runtime
(aka. RAC, Remote Agent Controller).

Since I cannot reproduce problem in both TPTP 4.0(built on Eclipse 3.1 rc1). I
am closing this bug, please reopen if you see the problem again in the latest
driver.
